answerText: the NFPA diamond [or the fire diamond; or NFPA 704; prompt on "diamond" or "NFPA"][10]  This diatomic weak acid earns a 4 in the blue section, since its low dissociation constant allows it to penetrate tissue quickly. It can dissolve most oxides and silicates and is especially useful for etching glass.
heading: MUT |2015 | 3 | 21 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Unlike the similar HMIS system, the white section in this system is used to indicate special hazards like oxidizers or asphyxiant gases.  [10] dentify either this standard or the safety symbol adopted by it, which in addition to the aforementioned section also includes sections denoting flammability, health hazards, and chemical reactivity.
